alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Northern Brevard; Inland Southern Brevard; Inland Volusia; Mainland Northern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 29 at 5:07PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Ian Has Strengthened to a Hurricane Once Again over the Western Atlantic with Strong Tropical Storm Wind Gusts Continuing Over Land... While Hurricane Ian continues to pull away from east central Florida over the local coastal waters, strengthening of this storm will continue. Portions of Volusia and Brevard counties, especially closer towards the coast, can expect strong tropical wind gusts through early evening. Many locations will see wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, but there may be occasional gusts of 65 to 70 mph and possibly just a little higher. Winds will slowly begin to diminish later this evening as the storm pulls further away from the area. In addition, we will see some rain bands move quickly southward down the coast. These squalls will bring briefly heavy downpours and very gusty winds of tropical storm force, as strong winds above the surface mix down to the ground.
